file_content.text: I hear you.
Looks like ol' Doc got here just in time. How have you survived with a droid and Little Miss Uptight as your only friends?
Teeseven's as loyal as they come--and you should address my fellow Jedi by her name.
Be nice to my crew.
No offense intended. I stopped listening to names after I heard yours.
Right. What's her name? Sneera? Kannoyah? Never mind.
This is no party, Doc. We're on an important mission.
Do you think this is a club?
We can save the galaxy and still have a good time, right? Leave everything to me.
I thought I was about to die of boredom.
They are pretty dull.
Not while I'm around. Anything happens, I'll be there to resuscitate you.
Your girl's a cold fish, huh? Knew it wasn't just me.
Before I settle in, a few things. First, I like my quarters kept at least five degrees warmer than the rest of the ship.
I only eat energy pudding, so stock up on that. Also, give me thirty minutes in the refresher every morning. That's all.
I'll at least accommodate your standard of living on Balmorra.
I'll see what I can do.
Bar's pretty high. Had it awfully good there.
Are you sure there isn't more? I could have Teeseven clean your laundry--or read you bedtime stories.
You're being silly.
Make my own bedtime stories, gorgeous. Play your cards right, I'll make yours, too.
Laundry service? Done--and have the girl turn down my bed every night.
If it wasn't for me, you'd be unemployed on Balmorra. Be thankful for what you get.
Get over yourself.
Ooh, tough negotiator. I like a little fire. We'll get along fine.
All I'm saying is, world class medical care isn't free.
Never seen a ship's medbay right next to the engine compartment before. Not exactly convenient.
I've done better with worse. Until I have everything online, stay in one piece. Doctor's orders.
Funniest thing... that thrill I used to get from saving a patient? It's gone. Once you're saving the galaxy, nothing else compares.
I mean, how many doctors get to say they saved a septillion beings? I'm thinking it's just me.
Without your help, the Emperor would've destroyed us all. You're a hero.
It's true.
I even got the medals to prove it.
I wouldn't add "saving the galaxy" to your resume right now. The Emperor's still out there.
Don't count your victory yet.
We'll have that crazy Sith under our thumbs in no time, or my name isn't Doc.
Not many doctors have married a Jedi, either.
[Flirt] You're unique.
That's a different kind of thrill.
No one knows how many living beings there are in the galaxy.
That's a made-up number.
Good point. It could be twice that many.
I don't remember you being in the room when the Emperor fell.
You didn't save them--I did.
I fought the whole Imperial Army so you and the Emperor could go toe-to-toe.
The only person who'll get to say they saved the galaxy is me. Don't take credit for my work.
Victory will be all mine.
Come on--let me claim a few billion. Preferably on a planet where people know how to treat a hero.
Point is, if you hadn't taken me along for this ride, I would've missed out. I appreciate that.
In fact, I'm offering free medical care for you and anyone else you want. Lifetime guarantee.
That's very generous, especially considering all the trouble we get in. You're making a big commitment.
Thank you, Doc.
And if I'd thought about that before saying it, probably wouldn't have used the word "free."
Does that offer expire with me?
Your lifetime or mine?
Good question. I'm gonna live forever, but you can't expand my commitments after you're gone. We'll figure it out later.
Free medical care for the galaxy will make us even.
I want you healing everyone.
Did I say "free"? I meant "steeply discounted."
I've also figured out a way for us to have children without having to explain it to anyone.
Those robes you people wear are pretty spacious. I'm betting we could hide a little Doc under them.
Our genetics have key differences. Children might not be possible.
Can we even get pregnant?
There's always adoption. Balmorra's full of orphans who need a good home.
There's more to keeping a child secret from the Jedi Council than hiding the mother's belly.
We'll see.
Once the kid's born, we'll just tell everyone it's my cousin. It'll work. Trust me--I'm a doctor.
I'd love to raise a family with you.
That's a wonderful idea.
We can't even consider children until the Emperor's been dealt with. After that, I'll put serious thought into your proposal.
After we save the galaxy, yes.
I'm a big fan of thinking, myself. Can't wait to put our heads together.
Marrying you is one thing. I'm not ready to raise a family.
No children. Not ever.
You keep telling yourself that. Ol' Doc's a patient man.
I'll make a great dad. Think of everything I can teach the little scamps.
All right, you win. Here's the deal: I'm good-looking, smart and charming. I'm a top-flight medical specialist who does charity work.
I've completely stopped looking at other women, which should be physically impossible. Bottom line, I'm pretty sure I love you.
This war may go on forever, but that's no excuse not to get married. Can't believe I just said that.
The galaxy could end any second, but that's no excuse not to get married. Can't believe I just said that.
In a strange twist of fate, it turns out you're the only person I can truly count on.
I'll marry you, Doc.
I don't care what the Jedi Code says. I love you, and I want us to be together.
Whew. For a second I thought you were gonna say "maybe" and I'd have to ask all over again later.
You didn't actually propose. I can't tell if you're applying for a job or just babbling.
Said what?
Knew I should've written this down....
Please don't tell me you rehearsed that. I prefer to think you've suffered some head trauma and are rambling incoherently.
That was a terrible proposal.
I didn't hear a "no." That's a start.
I want us to spend the rest of our lives together, like the Wookiees. I'm asking you to make an honest man of me.
I don't know about the "honest" part, but I'll happily spend the rest of my life with you.
I'll do my best. [Accept]
Seeger! Get your shiny tail out here! It's a go!
I am Ceremony, Gala and Ritual droid designation CGR-80. You may call me "Seeger." Shall we begin your joining?
There's no time like the present.
Yes. Immediately.
I've been keeping Seeger on standby. Didn't want you getting cold feet and running for it.
Have you been hiding on my ship? I need to chat with Sergeant Rusk and Kira about security.
Where did you come from?
Please--they're no match for ol' Doc. I've had Seeger on board for weeks.
We're letting a droid marry us? That's insane.
Doc, this is ridiculous.
No, it's perfect. Seeger will delete the whole ceremony from his database when we're done. You'll never get in trouble for breaking Jedi rules.
Please hold hands while I recite the Terms of Bonding.... In all the galaxy, there is no greater force than true love.
Love sustains, nourishes and protects. Without love, the galaxy would be cold and empty. Your bond lends fire to the stars, dissolving the darkness.
Do you take this man as your husband, to cherish for the rest of your days?
I do. Now and forever.
Yes.
I suppose it's too late to back out.
Oh, all right.
Not funny.
That's an awfully long time. What if a better man comes along?
What if I get a better offer?
Better than me? Impossible.
Do you take this woman as your wife, to honor in word and deed?
Definitely and always. We married yet?
May your love transcend time, distance and all barriers between. The Terms of Bonding are complete. You may now kiss.
Seeger, be a good droid and deactivate yourself. We'll drop you off at our next stop.
Please do. I am scheduled to preside over a Rodian harvest festival in three days. Rodians expect punctuality....
So there you have it. You and me. Together forever.
I never imagined it happening like this, but now I can't imagine it any other way.
Perfect. [Kiss Doc]
I don't know what that means, but it sounded good.
You're sure this is what you really want?
Any doubts or regrets?
Too late to back out, beautiful. You're stuck with me.
The best thing about quick marriage ceremonies is, you can get right to the good part.
Time for the honeymoon.
And that's why I love you.
I don't want you to change, Doc. We can be together without getting married.
Let's keep things as they are.
I wish somebody'd told me that! Maybe I can still get back my deposit....
Don't worry about me. Ol' Doc's up for anything, sweetheart. Whatever you need, I'm your man.
I appreciate you asking. It's nice to know you care.
Thank you for the sweet offer.
Seemed like you needed a little pick-me-up. Thought I could help out.
That goes without saying.
[Flirt] Yes, you are.
Doesn't have to. I kinda like hearing it.
You're one of my men. Top five, definitely.
I wouldn't go that far.
Come on! I at least qualify for top three. You can't tell me Big Blue and Lord Sithypants have anything I don't.
We've never even kissed. I'm not sure keeping things the same means we're "together."
I'm not closing the door on anything, Doc.
Maybe someday.
Guess that'll have to be enough.
I was trying to let you down easy. We're not meant to be, Doc.
We aren't--and never will be.
A simple "no" would've been plenty.
Excuse me, gorgeous. I have some, uh, things to cancel. Honeymoon Palace on Naboo, for starters. We'll continue this later.
And for the record... I would've made a great husband.
I'm a Jedi, Doc. I can't marry you--and I never should have let things go this far.
I can't. [End relationship]
I think it's better if you and I are just friends, from now on.
Friends... right. Far be it for ol' Doc to argue with your superior wisdom.
Let's not drag this awkwardness out. I'll see you around....
This end-of-the-galaxy business we're always mixed-up in... it can't last, right? Sooner or later, we'll win. Then what?
If someone was going crazy... would your Jedi powers let you know?
I wish that were true. Would've saved me a lot of trouble.
They don't work like that.
I don't need Jedi powers to see you've been avoiding me lately.
Are we talking about you?
I haven't avoided you at all--believe me.
You seem a little nervous, Doc. Everything alright?
Are we talking about you?
I'm fine. Probably. How would I know if I wasn't?
I've known about your insanity for a long time. I've chosen to ignore it.
[Lie] Definitely. You're nuts.
I don't mean my usual liveliness.
Thing is, I've been thinking about someone. A lot. Can't get her out of my head. That's not normal.
Sounds like you're developing real feelings for her. She must be special to you.
[Flirt] It might be.
Doc doesn't develop feelings--but she is special.
Unless that someone is standing in the room with you, we probably shouldn't have this conversation.
You'd better mean me.
Like I have time to date anyone else.
Clearly, you're infatuated with the woman.
You sound obsessed.
That's not necessarily bad, is it?
I wouldn't worry. "Normal" isn't a word most people associate with you.
Nothing about you ever is.
I'm not worried about most people. Just one.
If I'm going crazy, I don't want to be the only one. You think she might feel the same way about me?
She keeps coming back, despite her better instincts. That can only mean one thing.
[Flirt] I'm here, aren't I?
Interesting. And what exactly is "this"?
Sounds like you have a plan.
No clue. But we're gonna find out together.
Nice to see you're more than just another slick operator.
I like the new you.
Don't be silly. I'm the best slick operator there is.
There's a reason we never stopped with just one kiss.
[Flirt] Then don't stop.
I've been waiting for this a long time. Too long.
I'm just glad I finally did.
You should've just asked. I never make a lady wait.
You haven't made things easy on yourself. I would've kissed you a long time ago, if you'd treated me better.
You were being an idiot.
Better than what? Scratch that. Pretend I said something charming.
This is no time for questions.
[Flirt] Don't ask why.
I keep waiting for this to get stale. It keeps staying fresh. That's... weird.
I'm not a patient guy... but that was definitely worth the wait.
She might be waiting for you to behave like an adult, for a change.
Maybe--if you grow up.
Adults, huh? I studied those in med school.
She may not think you're the right man for her.
Probably not.
What if I am? It'd be a big mistake to shoot me down without being sure.
All I know is, I can't stop thinking--and that's a first.
Now that the galaxy has a future again, maybe ol' Doc better cogitate on his future--and who's in it.
Sooner or later, you and me are gonna save this galaxy. Might be time to start thinking about our reward.
Lynlee... she was a sweet girl. Wonder whatever happened to her? Hope she caught that shuttle off Malastare. Probably should've left her some credits....
This is the worst day of my life! Some idiot bounty hunter killed Nem'ro the Hutt before the Journal of Xenomedicine could examine him.
They can't verify my treatment worked because Nem'ro's a big messy puddle of goo. There's no proof I saved him.
Someone murdered Nem'ro? That's awful news.
What a horrifying crime.
You're telling me. I staked my whole career on him.
I know how hard you worked to develop that cure.
I'm so sorry, Doc.
The average Hutt lifespan is a thousand years. Nem'ro was only six hundred. Stupid bounty hunter!
I understand your frustration, but perhaps you have a destiny beyond mere fame and glory.
Life is like that, sometimes.
"Mere"? I was gonna be an immortal giant in the medical community.
My only hope is someone else coming down with the disease so I can cure it again. I'm not holding my breath.
The disease is rare. It could be years--decades--before I get another shot at it.
Another living being is dead, and all you can think about is how it inconveniences you.
Get some perspective!
I thought you were better than this. I thought you were a healer. Was I wrong?
Fame isn't everything. I've got my health. And I know this beautiful, smart woman.
Nem'ro wasn't a nice person, but he didn't deserve vaporizing. I'll send something respectful to his memorial service.
I know how your mind works. Don't even think about infecting someone with that terrible disease.
Don't do anything foolish.
I'm not a monster. It would be a mild strain.
You cured one incurable illness. You can probably cure more.
Just find another disease.
That's like saying if you save one planet, you can save another. All right, bad example--but you get my point.
You know what? The Journal of Xenomedicine can take a flying leap into a black hole. I'm starting my own blasted journal.
I've had enough medical adventures these past few years to fill a library--and I'm telling people all about them.
Good. Your knowledge will make the galaxy a better place.
Share your wisdom.
And if I get moderately famous in the process, that's alright, too.
There you are. I was wondering where the real Doc was hiding.
That's the Doc I know.
Ol' Doc never hides. He hibernates.
You don't need other people's approval to tell your story.
That's the spirit.
No, but it helps.
Leave out your personal embellishments. This could become an important resource. Keep it pure.
Be sure you tell the truth.
I'm always honest. I can't help leading a legendary lifestyle.
Publishing a HoloNet journal won't be easy. I'm gonna need recorders, edit droids and a good s-thread broadcaster.
That's some serious scratch. I'll have to start charging for my services. You understand.
I'm willing to invest in a worthy venture.
We'll work something out.
I only need a couple of million credits to get started. See what you can do.
Why don't we rob an Imperial bank for the money?
The Empire has credits.
This is why I keep you around. You say what I'm thinking.
In case you haven't noticed, Jedi aren't rich.
Charge me? Forget that!
Oh, please. This ship alone is worth more than I've made for the past three years.
Have you found a cure for Nem'ro the Hutt's disease?
The treatment formula's ready, and good thing--Nem'ro's half the Hutt he used to be.
Worry about your appearance after you've cured Nem'ro.
You haven't made history yet.
By then it'll be too late.
History will remember you as a handsome man.
[Flirt] You look great.
Sure, sure--but what about dashing and intelligent? Forceful, yet sensitive? That's what people expect from a doctor.
Can you possibly be more egotistical?
Get over yourself.
Why, you think it'll help? People expect doctors to act with confidence.
When I save Nem'ro's life, the holojournalists will be all over me. Ooh, here she comes....
Look at you, gorgeous. Love the new tattoo. Nice gun.
Let's get this over with. I don't enjoy playing hostage. Not for you, anyway.
I need to make sure Nem'ro doesn't try to keep me all to himself after I cure him. Hutts occasionally confuse gratitude with kidnaping.
Nem'ro's got a soft spot for my friend. I'm paying her to stay here as my hostage while I fly to Hutta. Brilliant, huh?
If you're worried about Nem'ro, take me with you. This hostage scheme is ridiculous.
No, it's insane.
Jedi don't have clearance to land on Hutta. This'll work--trust me.
What's the going rate for a professional hostage?
How much are you paying?
She charges by the minute. Worth every credit.
You are not leaving your old fling on my ship.
I don't want her here.
Don't get snippy. A Hutt's life is on the line.
Sit tight while I take care of business. I'll be back in no time.
But before I become the most important medical specialist since Korace Vondar, how about a kiss for luck?
You already have everything you need. May the Force be with you.
You don't need luck.
All right--but you owe me one.
Call me old-fashioned, but kissing in the presence of a hostage seems unladylike.
Not in front of her.
Pfft... you're no fun.
Now that's a heroic send-off.
Nem'ro will be healthy as a rancor in a meat factory, or my name isn't Doc.
Word to the wise: Every girl is allowed one indiscretion. Doc counts as two.
According to him, you broke your own rule.
He was good enough for you.
Some mistakes are more satisfying than others--but I suppose Jedi wouldn't understand that.
I bet you'd make that same indiscretion again.
You're jealous.
I prefer men who aren't in love with the sound of their own voice.
If you have a story to share, I'm all ears.
Do tell.
It's nothing you haven't already learned for yourself.
Jedi standards must be slipping if a worm like Doc qualifies as an ally.
Doc has saved my life many times. He's my friend.
He's a good man.
Jedi need him to stay alive? No wonder you people are losing the war.
Is that any way to talk about an old friend--especially one who clearly adores you?
Doc speaks highly of you.
I'm usually worshiped by men beneath me.
Anyone who's friends with Hutts must know all about slimy creatures. If you have dirt on Doc, let's hear it.
Tell me why you call him that.
Nothing you haven't already discovered yourself. If you've stayed with him this long, you deserve him.
Anyway, that's enough polite chit-chat. Is there anything interesting to eat on this rust bucket? I'm famished....
I did it! Nem'ro's gonna live! The disease is cured! He's already regenerating lost tissue and organs.
Wonderful news. I can leave. It's been amusing.
You're not gonna stay and help us celebrate?
Ha... no.
You did a great thing today. You cured an incurable disease. Saved a life.
Congratulations, Doc.
Even better--I saved someone famous. That's the kind of story the Journal of Xenomedicine loves.
That woman is a degenerate. She probably eats human hearts for breakfast.
I can't believe you like her.
Isn't she great? Uh, not as great as you, though.
I've already spent far more time here than I intended. Let's celebrate your impressive victory elsewhere.
Let's leave.
Just as well. I need to publish my findings to the Journal of Xenomedicine right away.
She said awful things about you. Be happy she's leaving.
She isn't a friend.
Not everyone can appreciate greatness. Lucky for me, I have real fans.
Are you kidding? I'm thrilled. The view's twice as good.
The important thing is, ol' Doc finally made his mark. When the Journal of Xenomedicine hears this, people will know my name.
Couldn't have done this without you. I'm putting your name in the "special thanks" section of my article. At the top, even!
Ol' Doc's luck is finally turning around! Got a holocall from this ravishing Rattataki I knew on Hutta. Big opportunity to cure something important.
I take it that means you're no longer attempting to create your own disease.
That's wonderful news.
Like I always say, a plague in the wild is better than two in the lab.
"Ravishing Rattataki," eh? Sounds like I might have some competition.
[Flirt] Should I be jealous?
Until you came along, she was the greatest afternoon I ever had. But don't worry--I'm over her.
Hard to say when I have no standard of comparison. She was really something.
Is this woman another broken-hearted lover you jilted along the way?
Who is she to you?
She wishes. We were like two ships passing in the hyperlanes. Never thought I'd hear from her again.
What were you doing on the Hutts' homeworld?
You lived on Hutta?
There was a big misunderstanding about a debt. I cleared it up.
My friend's old employer is a Hutt Cartel boss named Nem'ro. He's infected with an incurable disease. It's eating him alive--literally.
No one's ever cured what Nem'ro has. He'll pay top credits to any doctor who can save his life. This is my big chance.
You never said you were in this for the money.
I thought your goal was fame.
The credits are just a bonus. The real reward is my name on every Hutt's lips from here to the Deep Core.
Do you actually have a plan to fight this disease?
Can you cure Nem'ro?
I can already see where this is going--and the answer's "no."
Don't drag me into this.
Come on--it never hurts to have a Hutt in your pocket. Imagine how grateful Nem'ro will be to us.
Turns out, I studied this disease back in medical school. There's an experimental treatment no one's ever been able to try. It's too risky.
But I figure if there's a safe place to work with toxic chemicals, it's a Jedi starship. I know you don't mind.
Just tell me you know what you're doing.
I'd better not regret this.
After all this time, doesn't that go without saying? Besides, I started mixing the solution hours ago and the ship's still intact.
What exactly are you planning to bring on my ship?
Toxic chemicals?
The main ingredients are cyanogen silicate, ardanium and accelerite, but don't worry--I'm already mixing the solution and we're all still alive.
I don't want any toxic substances on this ship.
Actually, I do.
Relax, will you? I'm already mixing the solution and it hasn't exploded. That's a good sign.
Now give ol' Doc room to work. I've got a date with medical history.
It shouldn't be this hard to find a terrible disease I can cure--but all the good ones are taken!
All that's left are embarrassing things like Bothan Nether Rot, or diseases that'll take decades to treat. I don't have that kind of time.
There's bound to be something you can cure. Does it have to be a major disease? There are plenty of uncommon ones.
Look into rare diseases.
You don't understand how medicine works. If no one knows it's a disease, they don't care if you cure it.
Even if you never cure a disease, you'll always be the galaxy's greatest doctor to me.
[Flirt] You're still my hero.
That's sweet. Not helpful, but sweet.
Do I want to know what "Bothan Nether Rot" is?
Bothan Nether Rot?
The diagnosis is too gruesome for delicate ears. Forget I mentioned it.
If you ever develop purple-green discoloration in the trouser area, tell me so I can leave the ship immediately.
That's your excuse? Why don't you just admit you lack the skills?
Or the talent.
I'm as skilled as they come! All I need's a good challenge!
This won't keep me down. I'll cure an important disease even if I have to create it myself. Say... that's not a bad idea.
The galaxy doesn't need any new diseases, Doc.
Yes, it is.
What's the harm? I'd cure it right away.
I know better than to criticize your terrible ideas. You'll figure it out on your own.
I won't even try arguing.
I could mix a little Pig-lizard Flu with a strain of Gamorrean Mumps... oh, yeah--this is going somewhere.
If you could invent a disease that only infects the Sith, you'd be plenty famous.
Create a Sith-only plague.
Then I wouldn't need to develop the cure. Not bad.
I'm glad you stopped by, but ol' Doc has thinking to do. You should go meditate. Clean your lightsaber. Whatever.
Every time I think I've seen it all, the galaxy shows me something new and crazy.
The latest Journal of Xenomedicine reports that Wookiees live for centuries--and mate for life! How can they do that? It's unnatural.
I don't think the Wookiee population would appreciate that sentiment.
Not according to Wookiees.
I'd never say that while there's one standing around. I like my arms. But still... weird.
So you lack the endurance to stay with a woman more than a few weeks?
[Flirt] You disappoint me.
If she was a really good kisser, I could be with the right woman for months.
It's not about endurance, gorgeous. It's about enthusiasm. Always best to quit at the top of your game.
Being with the same man for the rest of my life? No thanks.
I agree completely.
I'm supposed to believe if ol' Doc offered you a lifetime commitment, you'd turn me down? Not that I'm... it was hypothetical.
Trying reverse psychology, huh? Doesn't work on ol' Doc, sweetheart. I know you're crazy for me.
Catching up on the latest medical data always makes me hungry--and I hate eating alone. What do you say, beautiful? Grab a bite?
What are we doing, Doc? Jedi aren't supposed to have relationships. I keep hoping I'm breaking that rule for a good reason.
Not until we talk about us.
But all I see is a man who runs when things get complicated.
My name isn't "beautiful," "gorgeous" or "sweetheart." Keep calling me those, and you'll be on a liquid diet.
I hate your pet names for me!
They're just nicknames. Didn't mean anything by them.
Read you loud and clear. No more nicknames--that's a promise, darling.
Now, how about that meal? A healthy diet will keep your lightsaber arm strong.
This isn't only about how you talk to me. I need to know if I'm wasting my time.
I'm not done talking about us.
The Jedi Council would punish me if they knew about our relationship. Do you even care?
I think you're a better man than you pretend to be, Doc. I just wish you'd stop pretending.
You ask me to risk everything, while you risk nothing. I won't do that.
I'm not trying to take advantage of you. I thought this was how you wanted things. No attachments.
Let's end this now.
I'm not asking you to risk anything. We're just having fun, right?
If I'm breaking the Jedi Code, it can't be for a casual fling. It has to mean something.
I want more.
I can't be responsible for messing up your career. Ol' Doc's too much of a gentleman for that.
Let's you and me take a little breather. You'll feel better, I'll feel better. We'll come back fresh.
I'm, uh... gonna eat now. We'll talk later.
I suppose I'm not actually breaking the Jedi Code if we never form a real bond. And you are fun....
[Flirt] Maybe you're right.
We have a bond. It's relaxed, that's all.
See? We're having fun.
This isn't working out. From now on, our relationship is strictly professional.
Not anymore. It's over.
I'm eating alone, huh? If you change your mind... aw, who am I kidding?
We took this as far as it can go. Time for ol' Doc to move on.
I came here hoping to relax and unwind.
[Flirt] I'd prefer some rest.
This little chat spoiled my appetite.
Not in the mood. Goodbye.
You don't have to eat with me, but... take care of yourself.
I had something else in mind, but if you aren't feeling up to it....
[Flirt] That wasn't my plan.
Snack time can wait.
I swear every time we're together, it's different. You're not using Jedi mind tricks on me, are you?
I only use it on people trying to resist me.
I would never do that.
Good point. Must be something else.
Would you be excited if I said "yes"?
[Flirt] What if I am?
Sure. I mean, no. I don't know. Are you doing it right now? Don't answer that.
Keep it casual. You sound like a girl.
Don't get weird on me.
What? Naw, I'm making a clinical observation. Sheesh....
I'm tired, that's all. Been a long year.
This was... interesting. I mean... good. I'm hungry.
Sergeant Rusk better have left me some energy pudding. Crazy soldier eats everything that isn't nailed down. I'll, uh, see you around.
All right, now I'm really hungry--but it was worth it. What's a little starvation between friends?
Get yourself a meal. I'll be busy saving everyone's lives.
Go eat--I have work to do.
And we appreciate that.
I'm a bit famished, myself.
I'm hungry, too.
Race you to the food storage.
Stop complaining. I should be enough for you.
You'll survive.
Man can't live on stunningly beautiful Jedi alone.
If Sergeant Rusk ate all the energy pudding again, I'm gonna be upset. That man has no respect for other people's food.
Ol' Doc's always been more of a lover than a fighter, but I had to up my game since you came around.
It's not easy looking good when you're fighting next to a Jedi, but I've figured out the trick.
Care to clue me in before our next big battle?
I'd like to hear it.
Let's just say I'm getting a new nickname: "Doctor Knockout."
You're dashing even when you're only standing around.
[Flirt] You always look good.
That comes naturally. I'm talking about skill, gorgeous.
I've never expected you to keep up with me, Doc. We all have our own strengths.
You're too hard on yourself.
"Keep up" with you? I'm leading the way, my friend.
Hiding behind me is working out very well for you.
Right--staying in my shadow.
What can I say? I like the way you move. Taught me some things.
If you'd just stop running and admit your true feelings, I'd be right alongside--kicking tail, taking names.
You got me all wrong. I've been researching. Studying your moves. Making my own.
Yep, next time we're surrounded by the scum of the galaxy, they're gonna be sorry they met me.
Can't believe this... standards at the Republic Health Administration must be nonexistent! I went to medical school with the new acting head.
Guy's a moron. Doesn't know a vibroscalpel from a field cauterizer. He barely passed final exams. How is he top doctor in the Republic?
It's been a while since you were in school together. His skills must have improved.
He must have earned it.
The only thing that improved was his bank account. Now he's gonna be in all the medical journals....
If what you say is true, he shouldn't be allowed to remain in that position. We should contact the authorities.
Sounds like trouble.
The authorities are the ones who put him in charge!
The Republic isn't a meritocracy. I'm sure he bribed all the right politicians.
Connections and payoffs.
This is what always happens. Real doctors go out and save lives. Idiots stay on Coruscant and get themselves promoted!
So what if this guy invented a vaccine for Zabrak Scalp Necrosis? I could've done it. I was just busy.
What is "Zabrak Scalp Necrosis"? It sounds bad.
Zabrak Scalp Necrosis?
Ah, it's just a low-grade flesh-eating virus. Makes Zabraks' horns fall out. Embarrassing, not life-threatening.
You're saving the whole galaxy--and keeping me alive, too.
[Flirt] You're a great doctor.
Sure, but nobody knows it. I'm languishing in heroic obscurity.
Don't let your rival's achievements get you down. You're much more successful.
You're doing great work.
What good is being great if there's no one around to hear about it?
If you spent half as much time practicing medicine as you do chasing women, you'd be famous, too.
No, you're lazy.
This isn't about fame. It's about glory.
Tell you this much--enough's enough. No more "Mister Nice Doc." The galaxy's gonna find out what a real physician looks like.
I gotta find a disease to cure. Something really unpleasant.
This ship is way too quiet. No offense to the others, but you're the only decent conversationalist here.
Of course, talking's the least of your skills.
I'm naturally gifted in many ways.
[Flirt] I'm multitalented.
I've only found two. You're holding out on me, beautiful.
Question is, are you interested in more than just talking?
We haven't spoken about Prudy on Alderaan. You left her broken-hearted, Doc. Why did you abandon her?
Tell me about your ex-fiancee.
I didn't abandon her. She was clingy. Making plans faster than I could react.
Prudy's a wonderful girl. Someday, she'll make a boring proper gentleman very happy. Ol' Doc just isn't the settling type.
What bothers you most: marriage, or commitment in general?
Define "settling."
That's a trick question--and the answer is, I love freedom. It's why I fight for the Republic.
There's no woman who could get you to settle down?
Not with anyone?
I never say never... but no--not happening.
From what I've seen, you did Prudy a favor by leaving.
Prudy's better off.
If every man was judged by his ex-girlfriends, we'd all serve life sentences without hope of parole.
Forget about Prudy, all right? She's the past. You're the now.
Being with you violates my vow of non-attachment. I can't do that lightly.
I'm a Jedi breaking rules.
Sure you can. Anything you break, I can fix. Trust me, I'm a doctor.
I'm the best you'll ever have.
[Flirt] I'm more than that.
Actually, I'm the later. Keep your schedule open.
[Flirt] Not at the moment.
There must be some reason I keep coming back here.
[Flirt] Maybe.
We both know what that is.
You're more obvious than a Sith Lord in a snowbank.
[Flirt] You're so crude.
Point is, you can't miss me.
We don't get much downtime. Be a shame not to take advantage of it.
I have other duties.
I should go.
My schedule is crowded. I'll need a very good excuse to clear it.
[Flirt] Tempt me.
No, just me.
Excellent point.
[Flirt] I agree.
We're getting good at this. But you know what they say about practice making perfect.
I don't consider myself a greedy man, but I'm making an exception for you.
The galaxy will survive a little while longer without us. What do you say?
We should get back to work.
Duty calls.
Wore you out, huh? It happens.
We deserve a vacation.
[Flirt] We've earned time off.
And I know just how to spend it.
You're... this was... I'm positive I heard your holocom beeping on the bridge. Might be important.
I, uh... need to clean the medbay. It's filthy. I'll see you later.
I'm busy. You'll need to make an appointment.
[Flirt] Wait your turn.
Stealing my lines? No fair, gorgeous.
Come back anytime. Soon is good.
We have got to get off this ship and do something besides beat up bad guys.
Those gangsters on Alderaan brought back some great memories. Well, they used to call me "Doc Operator," back in the day.
I was the go-to guy for everything medical. Trauma kits, surgical droids, hospitals--you name it, and I could get it.
One time, this Hutt was hoarding medpacs after a massive groundquake. Selling them at an obscene markup. I tricked Mandalorians into attacking his palace.
Pitting Mandalorians against a Hutt? You enjoy living dangerously, Doc.
You're lucky to be alive.
It's why you can't resist me.
You love that about me. Don't deny it.
Please. I risk more walking down the street with you.
Inciting violence hardly seems like a useful response.
And that helped how?
How else was I gonna liberate those medpacs?
If those Imperial lackeys are dumb enough to fall for your nonsense, it's a wonder they haven't been wiped out.
Mandalorians are idiots.
Don't sell me short. It was a pretty good lie.
I forged a death mark signed by the Hutt against the Mandalorian clan. They "accidentally" found it with a little help from yours truly.
The Mandalorians attacked the Hutt palace in record time. By sheer coincidence, I was there to sweep in and clear out the Hutt's medpacs.
You deliberately caused unnecessary deaths. Regardless of your goals, that was wrong.
That's horrible.
Come on--a greedy Hutt and some bloodthirsty Mandalorians? Like the galaxy needs more of those.
You could've been killed doing that alone. Promise you'll take me along if you ever do anything that crazy again.
[Flirt] Get my help next time.
Done. I won't need the Mandalorians.
You did this without either side realizing they'd been manipulated?
And they never suspected?
It helped that they all killed each other. Sometimes things work out.
You expect me to believe that's all you took? I know how Hutts live.
What else did you steal?
The Hutt was hiding rare gems in a few medpacs. Strangest thing.
Thanks to an anonymous donor, every hospital in the disaster zone received supplies to treat their patients. Saved thousands of lives.
That was small-time compared to what we're doing. When we save the galaxy, I'm not staying anonymous.
What happened with the gangsters? Is your friend alright?
Those gangsters were smarter than I thought, but the Republic hostage negotiators talked them out of killing me. They were really something.
Sounds like the expert on talking finally met his match.
They must have been.
I was at a disadvantage. The gangsters really wanted me dead. The good news is, my old friend's fine. They forgot all about her.
I assume the woman you went to save also survived?
And your friend?
Ol' Doc never lets down a lady in distress. My friend got away clean.
You had to be rescued from your own rescue mission. Classic Doc.
I knew you'd mess things up.
I let myself get captured. It was the only way to keep my old friend alive. The gangsters completely forgot about her.
We never got the chance to catch up, but... hey, that's her on the holo. Probably wants to say thanks. Pretend you work for me, alright?
Sounds like you have some catching up to do. I'll go meditate.
I should leave you two alone.
Don't leave me alone with her.
That was ages ago, darlin'. Don't tell me you're holding a grudge.
Wow. This conversation got entertaining in a hurry.
This keeps getting better.
You can get along without me for a bit, right? Need to pop over to Alderaan.
Old friend of mine there got kidnapped by gangsters. They'll kill her if I don't deliver the spice they paid me for.
You realize selling spice is against the law? What's to stop me from turning you in?
Dealing spice is illegal.
They only paid me for spice. Never planned to actually deliver any.
How can you be so casual about this? Your friend is in terrible danger.
Shouldn't you be more upset?
Why worry? Ol' Doc's got everything under control.
This comes as no surprise. I've had you pegged for a degenerate lowlife ever since Balmorra.
I knew you were a criminal.
"Lowlife"? Ol' Doc's many things, but never that.
Couple of years back, I scammed this gang for a bulk-load of credits. Spent everything to set up a refugee hospital on Alderaan.
My friend is the head doctor there. Guess the gangsters finally figured out where all their money went.
They're holding your friend hostage until you give them their credits--or the spice.
And now they want it back.
This is a matter for Alderaan's law enforcement, not us.
Contact the authorities.
Way ahead of you.
What made you think stealing from gangsters was a good plan?
You're a complete idiot.
They're not the first gang that contributed to my favorite charity. It's like taking candy from a baby.
I'm going undercover for Republic Customs. Once I deliver the spice and free my friend, the good guys swoop in.
Gangsters go to prison and my friend gets her hospital back. Whole plan's foolproof. Won't take any time at all.
Watch your back, Doc. Someone's always building a better fool.
All right, but be careful.
Don't I know it.
This sounds too dangerous for you to handle alone. I should come.
I should go with you.
That's sweet, gorgeous--but there are some things a man just has to do for himself.
I can take care of these laserbrains, pal. You keep the Sith busy until I get back, alright?
You have a responsibility to this crew. You're not allowed to come and go whenever you like.
You can't just leave.
Relax. I'll be back before you know it.
Ah, the life of a combat medic. Long hours, grueling work... patients bleeding all over your nice clothes.
I'm not complaining. Nothing beats the look of gratitude from someone whose life you just saved.
But my female patients are always developing feelings for me. Some just won't take "no" for an answer.
You're a hard man to resist.
[Flirt] It's understandable.
Can't help being born handsome with charisma to spare. We all have our curses.
Perhaps you should limit yourself to only operating on men.
Male patients might be easier.
A doctor can't pick his patients. It's unethical--not to mention boring.
I see your difficulty. They find you revolting, ask you to fly into the nearest sun--and yet you refuse.
They despise you, don't they?
That was one time--and she had a head injury. The rest love me.
But it gets distracting when beautiful patients fall in love with you. Lots of ethical dilemmas, you know?
It's natural for attraction to develop under life-and-death circumstances. It's wrong to act on those feelings.
You must resist temptation.
Not if it helps the patient recover. Sometimes, you just have to go that extra step.
How often do combat medics meet beautiful women?
Does that happen a lot?
Why do you think I took the job?
You couldn't resist temptation if your life depended on it.
Not for you, I'll bet.
If she was married to a gangster, maybe. No, wait--did that.
I figure Jedi have the same problem. You must have admirers lined up from one end of the galaxy to the other.
Jedi have no interest in gaining admirers--or being admired.
We don't encourage that.
Could've fooled me, gorgeous.
You don't know what you're missing.
Only one of them actually matters to me.
[Flirt] None like you.
Sounds like a lucky guy. Introduce me, sometime.
I haven't had anyone throwing themselves at me.
Not really, no.
Might be afraid of breaking their necks.
Remember, it's quality not quantity--unless you have a lot.
I have billions of fans on Coruscant alone.
And back again.
Just imagine how popular we'll be after we knock the Sith Empire into a black hole.
If I were you, I'd get some extra sleep now.
Knew you were coming. Every time you're in the area, the local air temperature goes up ten degrees.
Are you a doctor or a weather droid?
How would you know that?
I'm all man, all the time.
Didn't realize I had that effect. You must be burning up, Doc.
[Flirt] You're the reason.
Not yet, but there's always hope.
That line was old when they founded the Republic.
You're so corny.
What can I tell you? I'm drawn to the classics.
We could dance around each other for weeks, beautiful, but who has that kind of time?
Let's admit the truth and get on with it. We're like two asteroids on a collision course. All that's left is... colliding.
I'm a Jedi, Doc. I have to be above personal attachments--especially the kind you're offering.
That's against the rules.
Didn't say we should elope to Nar Shaddaa. We're adults. What could one little kiss hurt?
One kiss always leads to another. It's better if we never start.
I'm sorry, but no.
Let's agree to disagree on that--for now.
You tell me....
We'll find out. [Kiss Doc]
[Flirt] It's too soon to tell.
Prepare for impact....
Then get ready. [Kiss Doc]
Careful what you wish for. I'll break you into a million pieces.
[Flirt] You can't handle me.
I'm sturdier than you think. Sounds like you're the one who's afraid.
It's for your own protection. I'm not like other women.
You're out of your league.
Don't I know it. Just not as well as I'd like to.
You can't fight gravity. Trust me, I've tried.
Just remember, I gave you a fighting chance....
You asked for it. [Kiss Doc]
Ah... I had this crick in my neck ever since Balmorra. You got rid of it, gorgeous. Thanks.
"Thanks"? I was expecting a little more, Doc.
That's all you have to say?
Oh yeah--you're a good kisser. Is that a Jedi thing, or just you?
This was fun. We'll have to do it again soon.
Even doctors need people looking after them.
[Flirt] Anytime.
You'd be amazed how few women understand that.
You and I are gonna get along great. Now scoot. Ol' Doc's got work to do.
I always suspected you were completely useless. Now I know for sure.
You're a pig.
Can't fool me, sweetheart. You'll be back for more of ol' Doc.
I suppose anything's possible.
We'll see.
You can't play hard-to-get now. It is kinda cute, though.
Don't count on this happening again, unless you're ready to behave like an actual human being.
Only if you drop the act.
Oh, come on--where's the fun in that?
Let's not ruin this moment with a bunch of talk, all right? Catch you later....
Maybe when the last star in the galaxy dies, I'll consider it. On second thought, no, I won't.
Not in this lifetime.
You're not the first woman who couldn't handle me. I don't take it personally.
At least we got the tension out of the way. It'll make working together lots easier.
I hardly know you. What kind of woman lets a strange man kiss her?
[Flirt] Only of strangers.
I get it. You enjoy the chase. All right--go ahead and run.
When you get tired, I'll help you catch your breath.
Gotta say, this is one comfy starship. Never saw anything this cushy on the Outer Rim. Those fringers use rocks for pillows.
And medical care? Forget it. Kolto might as well be a myth. Tough work, being a doctor outside the Core.
Healing the sick and wounded is difficult no matter where you are.
Or anywhere.
Try doing surgery without anesthetic. It's even harder if the patient doesn't get any.
I take it you didn't start your career on Balmorra?
Is that where you're from?
Born on Ralltiir, graduated Coruscant University. Highest honors.
You like things easy, don't you?
Couldn't handle it, huh?
Not necessarily, gorgeous--but I'm open.
Sure. Because if there's anything easy, it's hanging around a Jedi Knight.
I could've gone home, had a safe medical practice--and died of boredom. But I'm a man of action.
You have any idea how many people have tried to kill me for bringing quality health care to their planets?
In my experience, helping others is hazardous to your health.
It's dangerous work.
Luckily for my patients, I enjoy a challenge.
You must have a lot of unhappy customers.
Were they your patients?
All my patients love me--even the ones who don't make it.
The frontier worlds are crawling with pirates, gangsters and tax collectors. But they're no match for ol' Doc.
Not everyone needs a "laser sword" and mind tricks to get out of a tight spot.
I don't need them, either. They're just efficient.
But they do help.
Me, I rely on superior intellect and natural charm. Works every time.
You have your own special abilities.
[Flirt] Especially not you.
Nice of you to notice.
You wouldn't be here if I didn't respect your skills.
I didn't say you did.
You've got the Force. I bring the finesse.
If I were you, I wouldn't leave the ship without me.
They're called "lightsabers," you moron. Get it right.
Respect the Jedi weapon, fool.
No offense intended, sweetheart. I still respect you.
Touchy, touchy... what are you compensating for?
I'm sure this is a fascinating story--to someone else.
I couldn't care less.
You're adorable when you pretend you don't like me.
I save my best material for the ladies.
Go on. Don't wanna keep you from saving the galaxy....
So far, so good. Now that we're a team, figure it's only a matter of time before the whole galaxy gets saved.
Not too early for vacation planning, gorgeous. Ol' Doc's ready to whisk you away someplace special when this war's over.
When the Sith Empire is defeated, I'll go wherever the Jedi Council assigns me.
Jedi don't take vacations.
Sure, eventually--but until then, the stars are wide open.
I think you may have the wrong idea about us. Jedi aren't permitted to form attachments.
We can't be a couple.
Whoa... not looking to tie you down. Just enjoy a well-earned victory party.
And what will we do on this getaway?
[Flirt] Sounds nice.
What won't we do?
Working too hard is bad for you. Trust me, I'm a doctor.
Don't make me confine you to bed rest, beautiful. Unless you want me to....
I can take care of myself. Focus your attention elsewhere.
No thank you.
If you don't want my services, why'd you bring me on board?
Have it your way. I'll reserve my special care for somebody who'll appreciate it....
I trust your instincts. I'll do whatever's necessary to protect my health.
[Flirt] You're the doctor.
I like that in a patient. I recommend routine physical checkups.
In fact, you should stop by the medbay at least once a day. I'll clear my schedule.
Not if you were the last living thing in the whole galaxy.
[Flirt] You're not man enough.
What, you don't respect me as a doctor? I'm more than just a ruggedly handsome face, you know.
You'll come around. They always do....
Prepare yourself for fortune and glory, pal. You'll be up to your chin in beautiful women when this war's over.
My fans will be disappointed. It's against the Jedi Code for me to form emotional attachments.
No, I won't.
Who said anything about emotions? Wait... you can't enjoy the adoring public? Good thing I'll be there to comfort those poor women.
I don't do this for fame or wealth. Jedi are above those petty concerns.
That isn't why I fight.
Petty? You only say that because you don't know what you're missing.
Got news for you, Doc--I started that party early.
I already am.
I'll bet you did.
Ol' Doc's no stranger to the fame game. Cure a plague-ridden planet or two, and people get grateful enough to give you anything.
It's wrong to take advantage of such generosity. Good deeds are their own reward.
Which you should refuse.
Ha! Oh... you're serious.
That's amazing, Doc. Which worlds did you save?
You saved planets?
Ah, they're way off on the Outer Rim. Point is, millions are alive and kicking thanks to me.
If that's true, then why aren't you rich?
Apparently not.
Donated everything to charity. Can't take it with you, right?
Yessir, soon as this galaxy's saved, you've got a lot to look forward to. I'll be there to see you through it all, buddy.
Everything's copacetic. No need for any chitchat.
Normally, I'm a man of many words. But not today.
Gonna need a moment of your time. Soon is good.
Next time we're taking it easy, let's talk.
Need a private chat. Maybe on the ship? My quarters?
We should talk, but back on the ship is better.
You never told me you had a wife.
Doc, you're married?
Doc, is this woman your wife?
You two are married?
Whatever happened before, Doc risked his life to save you.
Doc is a good man.
You're a little high-strung for Doc. I don't blame him for running.
You aren't the woman for him.
Two years without so much as a holo, and that's all you can say? You abandoned me at our wedding!
I thought you loved me. You said all those wonderful things on Ord Mantell.
My parents flew all the way from Coruscant for a wedding that never happened. You loathsome cad! I wish I'd never met you!
I'd never have been kidnapped if it wasn't for him.
You look terrific, Prudy. Have you lost weight? Love the new hairstyle.
We're not married. We were barely even engaged.
We're just good friends. She's a little confused, that's all.
Prudy, sweetheart... those were sweet nothings. You should never take those at face value.
I didn't run. I... got sidetracked.
Some people simply aren't destined for each other.
It just wasn't meant to be.
You'd be amazed how many people share that sentiment.
That makes two of us.
Ugh! How do you live with yourself?
Destiny had nothing to do with it. He's a coward.
That's no surprise at all.
The gangsters burned it to the ground.
Look on the bright side, Prudy. You still have that hospital I bought you.
She still loves me.
Don't worry, I'm right here.
What are you asking me for? You're the Jedi.
Drop by my quarters after the others have turned in. I'll see what I can do.
[Flirt] We'll fix that.
Blast, I'm easy.
I've always been happy to just drift from one system to the next. Settling down is for... settlers.
The thing is, there's a lot to be said for a home-cooked meal and a warm bed at the end of the day.
That sounds like a good life. I think you've earned it, Doc.
You'd be much happier.
I'm not talking about me. I'm never leaving.
Are you sure you'd be happy living a quiet life?
Is that what you want?
Me? Ha! I'm talking about the rest of this crew.
You're a man of action, Doc. The last thing you want to do is become boring.
That life isn't for you.
Exactly! But we're not having nearly as much fun as we could, because we're surrounded by serious people.
We've got to convince Kira, Rusk and the others to retire. They're taking up valuable crew space we could use for more interesting personalities.
We could hire a Zeltron or even a Theelin--they're easy on the eyes. This crew could be colossal. Think about it.
Normally I'd kiss you for talking like that. But I'm trying to do this right.
Why'd it take you so long to finally admit that?
Oh, hey. Strangest thing... I was chatting with Kira, and I suddenly had this urge to rethink my past relationships.
Interesting. What were you and Kira discussing that triggered this?
That is odd.
I asked her what she likes in a man. Next thing I know, I'm sitting here by myself thinking about old girlfriends.
Sounds like you're the victim of a Jedi mind trick, Doc. I'm guessing Kira wanted to get rid of you.
Kira mind-tricked you.
What? You mean... that's dishonest! You people shouldn't do that to your friends! I oughta file a complaint with the Jedi Council.
From now on, I'm keeping my distance from Kira. If she can't play nice with ol' Doc, she won't play at all!
Any brilliant insights you'd like to share?
What have you learned?
It occurs to me I haven't always been a gentleman. My intentions were pure--it was the follow-through that got me in trouble.
On the other hand, the follow-through is why they always forgive me. Aah, I'm over-analyzing things. I should eat something....
My friend's on her way to help. How's my hair? These clothes fit alright? Ol' Doc's gotta look his best for the historical record.
I'm sure you old flame will be impressed. Why is she coming here?
And your ex-girlfriend.
Hutt politics. It's complicated.
You'll get something much better than a kiss when you get back.
[Flirt] Once you're safe, yes.
I don't believe this. We missed the party of the millennium last night! It's all over the HoloNet. Music... dancing... attractive people.
We could've been part of that if we hadn't been on the wrong side of the galaxy--saving everyone's lives as usual.
Two heroes of the Republic would've been colossal at that shindig. Infinite opportunities for romance. We would've had it made.
What you mean is, you would've had it made. I would've been stuck keeping you out of trouble.
Fun for you, not me.
If that trouble was one point six meters tall with green eyes and red hair, I'd have let you off the hook.
Just think how much more "colossal" we'll be at these parties once the Empire is defeated.
Maybe next time, Doc.
We've already earned more admirers than we'll ever have time for. Anything extra is just wasteful.
I'm the famous hero of the Republic. You're just my loyal sidekick.
What do you mean "we," lackey?
I prefer the term "wingman." And you wouldn't even know about these parties if I wasn't around to tell you.
I'm in the prime of my life, and I'm spending it with people who enjoy running around on exploding planets.
All I want is to abuse our fame, just for one night. Is that so wrong?
Don't get me wrong--that's important. But it wouldn't kill us to go out and socialize a bit.
I know all the best clubs. I'll show you around, make some introductions. Never know who you might meet. It'll be fun.
When the Sith Empire is finally defeated, I'll be able to relax.
We have a galaxy to save.
You can't put a conditional like that on your life. What happens if we all die or get really old and boring before then?
I have better things to do than spend time with the sort of people you think are "fun."
No, it won't.
Is the last step of becoming a Jedi Knight having your sense of humor removed? It would explain a lot.
You keep saying "no" all you want, but ol' Doc's not gonna stop asking. Might as well give in and live a little, right?
Lead the way, Doc. Where should we start?
Sign me up.
Everyone will tell you Nar Shaddaa is the place to be, but that's just hype. Truth is, Hutt space is full of boring tourists.
If you want real fun, you have to visit the private clubs. They're invitation-only. No tourists allowed.
Give ol' Doc some time to work his magic. I'll get us invited to the best club this side of Ord Mantell.
I need the Jedi Council's holofrequency. Ol' Doc's gonna have a chat with your bosses.
This code you people follow has you wrapped tighter than the Emperor's shorts. It's not healthy.
In my professional experience, enjoying life on a regular basis dramatically reduces your chances of falling to the dark side.
How exactly would indulging myself lead me away from the dark side?
Explain that theory.
It's like swallowing tiny doses of poison for an extended period. Eventually, you develop a tolerance.
Peace and contentment are the foundation of a good life. Everything else is only a distraction.
I enjoy a simple existence.
This is exactly what I'm talking about. You have no idea what you're missing!
You don't understand the first thing about being a Jedi.
Don't be foolish.
See? You're cranky. If you just relaxed a little, that chip on your shoulder would fall right off.
Glad I'm around to keep things lively. This ship would be way too serious without me.
If we die, at least it'll be heroic. But we're not gonna die, right?
Between my good looks and your lightsaber, there's nothing we can't do.
Just when I thought this couldn't get crazier....
Every time I think I've seen it all, the galaxy shows me something new and crazy.
I'm in the prime of my life, and I'm spending it with people who enjoy running around on exploding planets.
Ah, the life of a combat medic. Long hours, grueling work... patients bleeding all over your nice clothes.
Hey, look at that. We're alive. Nice work.
This is gonna be one of those days. I can already tell.
I keep getting offers to go work in a medcenter. I keep telling the doctors, "No, I like getting shot at...."
My life's so much more exciting since you showed up.
Don't do anything I wouldn't do. Actually, I can't think of what that might be.
